Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the log, each case starts with Receive Application (RA). Then, Validate Form (VF) follows. After that, Assess Eligibility (AE) happens. Now, here's where it varies. In case 1 and 3, after AE, there's a Request Missing Info (RMI), then another VF, and then Approval Decision (AD). In case 2, after AE, it goes straight to AD. So RMI and the subsequent VF are optional and can repeat. Wait, in case 3, RMI happens twice.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So the main flow seems to be RA -> VF -> AE -> (loop: RMI -> VF)* -> AD -> SC -> AC. The loop is optional and can occur multiple times.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For the RMI and VF loop, the loop body would be the sequence RMI -> VF. Then, the loop operator would have this sequence as the first child, and the second child would be the same sequence again.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - IND
Text: According to the definition: * (A, B) means execute A, then either exit or execute B and then A again. So the loop is A followed by a choice between nothing (exit) or B followed by A.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - NE
Text: In case 3, after AE, there are two RMI events, then VF. So the sequence is AE -> RMI -> RMI -> VF. So the loop here is RMI followed by VF, but in this case, RMI is executed twice in a row, then VF.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: The loop is just RMI, and after the loop, VF is executed. So the structure would be a loop of RMI, then VF.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: After AE, an XOR choice between: Proceeding directly to AD. Or Do the loop of RMI's, then VF, then AD.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: The loop is * (RMI, tau), meaning that after RMI, you can choose to exit or do tau and loop again.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 1: RA, VF, AE, RMI, VF, AD, SC, AC. Matches. Case 2: RA, VF, AE, AD, SC, AC. Matches. Case 3: RA, VF, AE, RMI, RMI, VF, AD, SC, AC. Matches.
